author: samwilsn
content: 2474 is an interesting approach. Is there any reason you prefer it over 2938? Just the simplicity?

author: 3esmit.stateofus.eth
content: I don't have a preference, anything that enables account abstraction I would be happy with, but 2474 I'm the author, so I am just defending it, basically yes, over simplicity.

author: lightclient
content: if we accept the cost of verifying an ecdsa signature and a couple state look ups, is there an advantage of 2474 over just including a tx with gas price = 0?

author: 3esmit.stateofus.eth
content: <@!543900561460822016> no, that's the only advantage at EVM perspective (i.e. ecrecover cost of wrapper tranasction with gas price 0). However the transaction pool/validation/replay also would have to be changed, making it possible for developers to create a contract that accepts to be called only by coinbase.  The changes in the transaction pool are better explained in this soft fork proposal (Gas Abstraction) https://github.com/ethereum/EIPs/blob/7dbd4d0e94f35826e6c6e2390715c4e62e614539/EIPS/eip-2473.md

author: 3esmit.stateofus.eth
content: For 2938, I like this solution, and I am looking forwards it, if it gets implmented I will abandon EIP 2474 because `AA_TX_TYPE` is equivalent to Coinbase calls. I also like `PAYGAS` opcode, I wonder how that's going to fit on Solidity.
